title: Honey Roasted Chickpea and Avocado Salad

salad: 4 to 5 cups chopped romaine lettuce (or lacinato kale if making ahead)
1 cup corn (fresh, canned, or thawed frozen)
creamy_herb_dressing: 2 tbsp tahini (or 3 Tbsp plain full-fat Greek yogurt)
1 clove finely grated garlic (or 1/2 tsp granulated garlic)

instructions: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Rinse and dry chickpeas thoroughly.
Toss chickpeas with 2 tsp olive oil and salt. Roast for 40 minutes, shaking pan every 15 minutes.
Mix remaining 1 tsp oil, honey, Dijon mustard, and cinnamon. Toss roasted chickpeas in glaze.
Turn oven off, return chickpeas to oven with door ajar for 20 minutes. Cool completely.
Whisk dressing ingredients together, adding warm water to reach desired consistency.
Combine lettuce, tomatoes, corn, avocado, feta, and basil in a large bowl.
Add half the chickpeas and dressing; toss to combine. Top with remaining chickpeas and drizzle with remaining dressing.
notes: Use kale instead of romaine if making ahead to prevent sogginess.
Add chickpeas just before serving to retain crunch.
Chickpeas can be roasted a day ahead but won’t stay crispy beyond that.
For a vegan version, use maple syrup instead of honey and omit or replace feta with plant-based cheese.
